thread.title: Lucky draw for place in a queue
thread.title_full: Lucky draw for place in a queue

author: Aidan Devine
title: Lucky draw for place in a queue
text:
IT resembled a lucky draw, except the winners only earned front position in a queue.
A developer in Liverpool yesterday defied conventional methods of releasing new homes to the market by hosting a ballot to determine who would be eligible to buy.
Mirvac decided rampant demand had made the ballot the only “fair and transparent” way of releasing houses at its Brighton Lakes development — 500 people registered but just 44 homes are currently available.
Ballot winners Daniell Fernandes and Jasmaine Vella stand in front of the development site. Source: News Limited
The ballot capped the number of people eligible to buy one of the homes at 150, who now have a chance to purchase on September 5 when sales begin. Mirvac head of residential John Carfi said many people had been waiting for some time to purchase in the new estate.
Winners are grinners: a woman smiles as her number is drawn. Source: News Limited
“Our greatest challenge has been dealing with the huge volume of people who want to buy,” Mr Carfi said, adding that the system would be used in future whenever demand far exceeded supply. Daniell Fernandes, 27, and partner Jasmaine Vella, 24, were among the prospective buyers who had their numbers drawn.
The Brighton Lakes development will be built later this year. Source: Supplied
“It’s not an ideal system for buying a home, but it beats camping outside the sales office the night before to be first in line,” Mr Fernandes said. The couple are eagerly awaiting the official release of Brighton Lakes homes next weekend, but admit they are only halfway to getting a property.
“We have the chance to buy one of the homes, but it doesn’t mean we will actually get one. We still have to compete with the other people whose number got drawn in the ballot.”
A community green at the heart of the development will include a tennis court, swimming pool, playground and barbecue facilities.
Originally published as Lucky draw ... for place in a queue
